meanings.definition: Boast or brag about one's own achievements or possessions.
meanings.sent1: She would often vaunt her academic achievements to her friends.
meanings.sent2: He likes to vaunt about his new car to anyone who will listen.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to vaunt about its ability to mimic human speech.
meanings.sent4: The peacock seemed to vaunt its colorful feathers in front of the other birds.
meanings.sent5: The knight would vaunt his victories in battle to all who passed by.

meanings.sent1: His constant vaunt about his wealth became tiresome to his friends.
meanings.sent2: The king's vaunt about his power was met with skepticism by the court.
meanings.sent3: The cat's vaunt about catching a mouse was met with laughter by the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her vaunt about her cooking skills was proven false when her dish burned.
meanings.sent5: The politician's vaunt about his popularity was soon overshadowed by scandal.
